original: Leden, Ido Evert, docent, lektor, Göteborg, f. 27/11/12 i Kattarp, Malmöh. 1., av stat:mäst. Josef L. o. Edith Nilsson. G. 39 m. Majken Thorn-berg. Barn: Ido f. 42, Bo 44. — Stud:-ex. i Hälsingborg 31, fil. mag. i Lund 35, fil. Hc. 40, fil. dr 43, provår 44-45. Aman. v. kem. inst. i Lund 37-43, docent 43 (stip. 44), timlär. v. Malmö realsk. 40, Hvilans spec :gymn. 42-44, c. adj. v. Malmö tekn. lärov. 43-44. lektor v. Falu folksk :’Sem. 45, lektor i mat. o. kemi v. Hvitfeldtska lärov. i Gbg sed. 46, docent o. t. f. prof. v. CTH sed. 46. Skr.: Potentiometr. undersökn. av några kadmiumhalters komplexitet (grad:avh.) m. fl. avh. o. upps.
translated: Leden, Ido Evert, associate professor, lecturer, Gothenburg, born on November 27, 1912 in Kattarp, Malmöhus County. First child of civil servant Josef L. and Edith Nilsson. Married in 1939 to Majken Thornberg. Children: Ido born in 1942, Bo born in 1944. Completed high school exams in Helsingborg in 1931, obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in Lund in 1935, Master of Arts degree in 1940, PhD in Philosophy in 1943, probationary year from 1944 to 1945. Assistant at the Chemistry Institute in Lund from 1937 to 1943, promoted to associate professor in 1943 (scholarship in 1944), part-time teacher at Malmö secondary school in 1940, Hvilans special gymnastics school from 1942 to 1944, temporary adjunkt at Malmö Technical School from 1943 to 1944. Lecturer at the Folkskola Seminar in Falun in 1945, lecturer in mathematics and chemistry at Hvitfeldtska Gymnasium in Gothenburg since 1946, associate professor and acting professor at Chalmers University of Technology since 1946. Writings include studies on the complexity of certain cadmium compounds (thesis), among other essays and papers.
